title: KAPy configuration options
description: Configuration schema for KAPy configuration objects. These configurations are usually stored in the `config.yaml` file.

configurationTables.description: Paths to configuration tables. See the documentation for each table separately

inputs.description: Path to input configuration table, relative to working directory. See [inputs.md](inputs.md) for more detail.

secondaryVars.description: Path to configuration table for secondary variables, relative to working directory. See [derivedVars.md](derivedVars.md) for more details. Optional - if omitted, no secondary variables will be generated

indicators.description: Path to indicator configuration table, relative to working directory. See [indicators.md](indicators.md) for more detail.

periods.description: Path to period configuration table, relative to working directory. See [periods.md](periods.md) for more detail.

seasons.description: Path to season configuration table, relative to working directory. See [seasons.md](seasons.md) for more detail.

dirs.description: Directories for storing output and intermediate files. Can be specified as either absolute paths, or relative to the working directory. See the [KAPy concepts](../KAPy_concepts.md) documentation for a more detailed description of these items

regridded.description: Directory for storing indicators regridded to a common grid.

arealstats.description: Directory for storing statistics calculated over areas.

useAreaWeighting.description: Use area-weighting when calculating averages over a polygon or area. Nearly all climate data is presented on grids where the area of the pixels is not constant, but changes in space - for example, on a regular lat-lon grid, the pixels get smaller towards the poles. When this option is configured, the CDO `gridarea` operator is used to calculate the area of each cell, and weightings applied to the calculation of area statistics accordingly. Requires that CDO can calculate the cell area - otherwise, it is recommended to disable this option manually.

shapefile.description: Path to shapefile to be used for defining areas. When the path is undefined, averages are calculated across the entire domain. The path should point to the .shp file.

idColumn.description: Name of the column in the above shapefile to be used as a unique identifier code for the area.

areaName.description: Specific name under  the column in the above shapefile to be used as a unique identifier code for the area.

cutouts.description: Configures spatial-subsetting (cutting-out) of the input data.

oneOf.description: **shapefile**. Omit the cutout step. All available data in the input files is processed.
**lonlatbox**. Use the `sellonlatbox`operator from cdo to do the subsetting. Details of this operator can be found in the CDO documentation.

ensembles.description: Specify the percentiles [0-100] calculated from the ensemble. We allow three values, corresponding to the upper and lower confidence limits, and the central value.

outputGrid.description: Defines the common output grid onto which KAPy interpolates all indicators before calculating ensemble statistics. Multiple approaches to regridding can be configured, as described below.

oneOf.description: **none**. Omit the regridding step. Assumes that all files within an input type are on the same grid, which will be used as the output grid

**cdo**. Use the Climate Data Operators to do the regridding. For more information, see the CDO website, https://code.mpimet.mpg.de/projects/cdo. Installation of CDO is handled behind the scenes by conda as part of the KAPy environment setup - be aware that this may result in a different version of CDO being used to what you have by default. In the current configuration we default to bilinear interpolation (`remapbil`). If other operators are required, please file a feature request in GitHub.

gridName.description: String giving the name of the grid to be used in regridding filenames.

cdoGriddes.description: CDO grid descriptor, specifying the output grid. Following the way that CDO works, this can either be a path to a grid descriptor file, or one of the predefined grids e.g. `global_1`. For more information see the CDO documentation, specifically [section 1.5](https://code.mpimet.mpg.de/projects/cdo/embedded/index.html#x1-280001.5) about horizontal grids, [section 2.12](https://code.mpimet.mpg.de/projects/cdo/embedded/index.html#x1-6900002.12] about interpolation and [Appendix D](https://code.mpimet.mpg.de/projects/cdo/embedded/index.html#x1-995000D] for examples of grid descriptors.

picklePrimaryVariables.description: Should the the primary variables be stored as 'pickled' xarray objects (`True`) or written out to disk as NetCDF files (`False`).
